meanings.definition: The act of assessing something too highly or excessively.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's constant overassessments of my work made me feel stressed.
meanings.sent2: The company's overassessments of the market value led to poor investment decisions.
meanings.sent3: The overassessments of the chef's cooking skills made him believe he was a culinary genius.
meanings.sent4: Her overassessments of her own abilities were like wearing glasses with the wrong prescription.
meanings.sent5: The overassessments of the house's worth caused the sellers to lose potential buyers.

meanings.definition: An excessive or overly high assessment of something.
meanings.sent1: The manager's overassessments of the project's success were unrealistic.
meanings.sent2: The student's overassessments of his intelligence hindered his learning progress.
meanings.sent3: The overassessments of the dog's intelligence made everyone laugh at the silly pup.
meanings.sent4: His overassessments of his popularity were shattered when no one showed up to his party.
meanings.sent5: The overassessments of the car's value resulted in a failed attempt to sell it.
